div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1507 Abu Shusheh, near anc. Gezer, Ju- (429) daea, 1930 or earlier Burial: c. 330 B.C. (Naster) Contents: 62+ 6 AR, 9 AE Alexander III: 2 AE Local imit. of Alexander: 1 AR fr. Local imit. of Athens: 18 AR fr. Sidon: 18 AR fr.; 7 AE Tyre: 3 AR fr. ANS 1944.100.62647 ANS 1944.100.62649 ANS 1944.100.62663 ANS 1944.100.62667 ANS 1944.100.62668 Philisto-Arabian: 20 AR fr. Unc.: 2 AR. fr. Probably from the same hoard: Local imit. of Athens: 1 hemiob. Philisto-Arabian: 1 dr.; 4 ob. Disposition: Jerusalem (Rockefeller Mus.) 71; Cahn Oct. 14, 1931, no. 574-8 (= NNM 82, nos. 20, 27, 29-31); Cahn Feb. 27, 1933, no. 398 (= NNM 82, no. 25); New York 6 (the coins published in NNM 82) â€ Lambert, QDAP 1933, pp. 1-10, illus. Robinson, NC 1936, p. 199 Schlumberger, L'argent grec, p. 9, no. 17 Newell, NNM 82 (1938), pp. 47-58, illus. Naster, INCJ, pp. 5, 18-26 Kadman, INCJ, hoard 1
